## Lesson 4.3 Measures of Relative Position

```{r}
knitr::include_graphics("4_3Q1.jpg")
```
```{r}
# Enter data
diameters <- c(
  1.64, 1.59, 1.30, 1.51, 1.41, 1.64, 1.59, 1.47, 1.61, 1.68, 1.56, 1.32, 1.64, 1.41, 1.49
)

#Calculate the 53rd percentile
quantile(diameters, probs = 0.53)

```

```{r}
knitr::include_graphics("4_3Q2.jpg")
```

$$ z = \frac{x - \mu}{\sigma} $$
```{r}
# assign values
x <- 61.6
smean <- 52.3
sd <- 3.8

# calculate using the formula
(x-smean)/sd
```

```{r}
knitr::include_graphics("4_3Q3.jpg")
```

```{r}
# assign the data
scores <- c(
  53, 55, 81, 51, 55, 70, 79, 89, 55, 94
)

# create a summary of the data
summary(scores)
```

The whiskers will extend out to the min and the max. The beginning of the box will start at the 1st Qu. The end of the box will be at the 3rd Qu. The line through the box is the Median.

```{r}
knitr::include_graphics("4_3Q4.jpg")
```

```{r}
# assign the data
data <- c(
  30, 5, 42, 45, 37, 28, 24, 21, 25, 48, 26, 55, 30, 1, 56
)

# find the interquartile range
IQR(data)
```

```{r}
knitr::include_graphics("4_3Q5.jpg")
```

$$\text{percentile of x}=\frac{\text{number of values less that or equal to x}}{\text{total number of data values}}*100$$

```{r}
# assign values
percentile_of_x <- 7
pvalues <- 24

# isolate the missing variable 'total number of data values' and calculate
(pvalues*100)/percentile_of_x
```

```{r}
knitr::include_graphics("4_3Q6.jpg")
```

```{r}
# assign values
percentile <- 50
tvalues <- 343

# isolate the missing variable 'total number of data values' and calculate
tvalues*(percentile/100)

# answer = true
```

```{r}
knitr::include_graphics("4_3Q7.jpg")
```

```{r}
# step one: create an array
array <- c(
  5.7, 6.3, 5.7, 8.6, 6.7, 6.8, 6.5, 8.2, 6.5, 8.1, 5.9, 5.8, 7.4, 9.5, 6.9, 8.5, 7.3, 7.3, 5.7, 8.0
)

# step 2: order the array
ordered_array <- sort(array)
print(ordered_array)

# step 3: count values less than or equal to 6.6 and total number of values

threshold <- 6.6
count <- sum(ordered_array <= threshold)
total_numbers <- length(ordered_array)

print(count)
print(total_numbers)
```

$$\text{percentile of x}=\frac{\text{number of values less that or equal to x}}{\text{total number of data values}}*100 = \frac{8}{20}*100$$
```{r}
# step 4
(8/20)*100
```
